intro: Biermannia laciniata, commonly known as the slitleaf biermannia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that are deeply lobed and often have a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Biermannia laciniata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and showy blooms.
